name: Doodh Talai Lake
shortDescription: A scenic lake nestled between small hillocks near Lake Pichola.
breadcrumb: Home > Tourist Destinations > Doodh Talai Lake
tagline: One of Udaipur’s most popular tourist attractions
about: The road that takes visitors to Pichola Lake has another popular destination – the Doodh Talai Lake. The lake is nestled between several small hillocks which themselves are tourist attractions.
The Deen Dayal Upadhyay Park and the Manikya Lal Verma Garden are part of the Doodh Talai Lake Garden.
The Manikya Lal Verma Garden offers a stunning view of Lake Pichola and Doodh Talai Lake. It was built in 1995 by the Nagar Parishad of Udaipur.
A ropeway connects the hilltops and leads to the Karni Mata Temple. This 4-minute ride is Rajasthan’s first ropeway and offers panoramic views of the city.
howToReach: One can visit Doodh Talai from anywhere in the city by tonga (horse-drawn carriage), auto-rickshaw, or by hiring a taxi.

name: Jaisamand Lake
shortDescription: Second largest man-made sweet water lake in Asia.
tagline: A peaceful retreat surrounded by hills and forests
about: Jaisamand Lake is known for being the second largest man-made sweet water lake in Asia.
It was constructed to halt the waters of the Ruparel River.
The lake has a large central island that is home to several species of birds.
It is a popular picnic destination among locals and tourists.
howToReach: Jaisamand Lake can be reached via taxi or private vehicle from Udaipur city.
